meanings.definition: To produce more of something than is needed or can be sold.
meanings.sent1: Farmers sometimes overproduce crops, which can lead to waste.
meanings.sent2: The factory had to shut down temporarily because they tend to overproduce their items.
meanings.sent3: The bakery decided to play a prank on their customers by purposely overproducing cupcakes.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for gardening caused her to overproduce flowers in her backyard.
meanings.sent5: The chef's goal was to never overproduce food and always maintain freshness.

meanings.definition: To create an excessive amount of goods or products.
meanings.sent1: The company had to discard the overproduce due to lack of storage space.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, many businesses tend to overproduce to meet the high demand.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer accidentally overproduced the limited edition dress, causing a frenzy among buyers.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity seemed to overproduce paintings effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The toy manufacturer had to find a way to sell the overproduce before the new line arrived.
